TopicTitle: The thread for all things Curiosity related

Articles.Content:
Here's Nasa's page that will let you track where the Mars Science Laboratory is compared to Mars and its designated landing site until Nasa starts streaming live from the control room in about 9 hours.

Can't wait to recreate this in KSP in a few months!
haha, yeah we are all waiting for it, i just hope it goes as planed..
I got invited to the NASA Tweetup to see it launch, now I get to watch it land. I'm so excited.

Watch it live here:

http://eyes.nasa.gov/

I can't wait! I'm going to be having NASA TV and Kurtjmac's livestream going.

I hope we get a stock rover part soon as well.
I can't wait and I really hope it lands safe so it can maybe push space into the forefront of people's mind for a little while.

I can't wait and I really hope it lands safe so it can maybe push space into the forefront of people's mind for a little while.
I think space will be more prominent in people's minds if the lander fails.

I think space will be more prominent in people's minds if the lander fails.

But then their accusation would be: "You wasted all this money we hate you space people and we will not give you any money no more blargh"

Which, to me, would seem like a bad thing. Let's just hope it works out well for the folks at NASA.
If you are away from a computer, you can download the NASAtv app for a mobile phone, it's pretty useful when you don't have access to a computer/tv

Here's Nasa's page that will let you track where the Mars Science Laboratory is compared to Mars and its designated landing site until Nasa starts streaming live from the control room in about 9 hours.

Can't wait to recreate this in KSP in a few months!

that "Eyes on the solar system" app is very cool.

My modest contribution, an image from Celestia with Curiosity mod:
The 'pre-game show' is starting now on mars.jpl.nasa.gov/msl (click 'watch live' on that page)... Here's hoping for a non-Kerbal descent in a couple hours!
Let's hope history is written soon, it would really suck badly to see such a revolutionary and remarkably kerbal way to land end in a crater on the surface.
About an hour to go now!

The first moon landing...

The first shuttle launch..

The first lander on Mars

Now....this..it must succeed!

It's on! Live on NASA TV http://mars.jpl.nasa.gov/msl/multimedia/nasatv/

Imagine the the atmosphere at mission control at the moment.

-salute

GODSPEED CURIOSITY!

Watching http://www.ustream.tv/nasajpl with 3 other people

I'm watching this right now too, on NasaTV's stream (don't want the Ustream chat). They just severed communications, so I guess it's down to the vehicle now... They keep pushing how difficult the landing will be in the commentary.
I hope everything goes well. My only concern is wind gusts when the parachute is deployed could maybe move it off course a little or lot.
The margin of error is 20km, and with a landing radar with full RCS control it should hit the target..
30 Minutes!

Everyone get this ready

THEY'RE DOING THE SYSTEMS CHECK. HNNG

At first I wondered why they were eating peanuts... Then I realized the stupidity of using champagne.

As of right now, Curiosity is either a pancake of assorted wires and lab equipment or is safely on the surface. HNNNGGGG

Edited August 6, 2012 by simplemunrockets
I'm eating sunflower seeds and we've got a stash of food to help.
Looks like one of the controllers has a red and purple tinted mohawk... Jeb's brethren?

JOIN THE PARTY IN IRC FOLKS!

GO CURIOSITY!

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
